intro: Chamissoa altissima var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth chamissoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, and it produces clusters of white or pale pink blooms in the spring. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to garden environments.
